Which house are you in?? I’m a Gryffindor! 

Okay, I’ve been WAY too excited about sharing this mocktail series! I’m a little bit of a potter head and the holidays always make me think of my magical friends. 🥰

I’ll be sharing each of these recipes this week and I cannot wait for you to try them all… because they are all absolutely DELICIOUS! 

Time to have a Harry Potter themed party and be the best host everrrr!

We are starting off my Harry Potter Mocktail series with my house: Gryffindor! 

When I think of a Gryffindor I’m thinking courage, bravery, and warmth! So this is the only warm drink of the series and it elicits that comforting holiday feeling that I associate with Harry Potter books and movies! 

Drink:
Juice of 1 blood Orange 
Blood orange zest
2 cinnamon sticks
Thumb fresh ginger 
1 Oz cranberry concentrate 
Fresh vanilla 
Pinch salt
1 cup water 
Honey (to taste) 

Heat ingredients in a pan (minus honey) and let simmer for 15 minutes. Add in honey to taste and enjoy!

Spicy slytherin 🐍

This recipe was inspired by a cocktail I had at @matsuhisaaspen and it is SO DELICIOUS! With a bit of spice and polarizing cilantro, I think it fits slytherin perfectly!

“Simple syrup”:
2 heads cilantro
Juice of 2 limes
2 thumbs fresh ginger
1 serrano, seeds removed
1/3 cup honey 
2 cups water 
Pinch salt
* dissolve the honey in water to make a simple syrup and then blend with remaining ingredients. Drain through a fine strainer and store in your most slytherin container, like the snake in the video! 

For the mocktail:
1 oz. lime juice
2 oz. cilantro lime simple syrup
Top with sparkling water! 
I served over matcha ice cubes! I would also highly recommend a honey rim with sparkles*!

* I used @offlimits cereal glitter for the sparkles because it’s the only edible glitter I’ve found without a bunch of crap in it!

A happy Hufflepuff drink! Follow @holisticrendezvous for ALL of the Hogwarts house mocktails! 

This reminds me of a Hufflepuff because it’s bright and tart with the lemon, but also sweet and calming with the blackberries and chamomile! It just feels very loyal, kind, and patient to me 😝

Rose ice cubes:
Rose mold (in my Amazon storefront at the link in my bio)
Water 
Lemon juice
Lemon zest

Drink: 
1 cup chamomile tea
Juice of 1 lemon
1 tsp honey
Pinch salt
Handful blackberries
1/4 tsp charcoal

Make your ice cubes in advance! Then brew chamomile tea. Add in honey, lemon, and salt. While this cools, smash blackberries with the charcoal. Top with the chamomile lemonade, stir, and enjoy!

Follow @holisticrendezvous for all of the Hogwarts house mocktails!  A twist on the mojito with brain boosting benefits for my Ravenclaws! Is this your house?! 

Lion’s mane is a fantastic medicinal mushroom known for its brain health benefits, so it’s perfect for our intellectual Ravenclaws! I paired with butterfly pea flower tea for the blue that magically turns purple or pink when citrus is added!

Ingredients:
1 cup butterfly pea flower tea
1 dropper full of lions mane extract 
1 tsp honey (put it in warm tea to dissolve)
Fresh mint leaves, muddled 
Juice of 1 lime
Pinch salt
Blueberries! 

Rim: dip in honey and then coconut sugar

I’m obsessed with @oat.haus original flavor and think it tastes like a gingerbread man and cookie butter made a love child, so I used that to make these cuties! 

I’m thinking a drink with these may be in store in the future??

The perfect holiday dessert does not exi…

I love a gallete because they just look really beautiful and impressive. This one was made with lots of @danishcreamery sea salted butter. Plus, you can play around with flavors and they pretty much always taste good. This one tastes like the holidays and your loved ones will definitely love it! 

Crust:
1 cup almond flour
1 cup cassava flour
1 cup arrowroot flour
1 tsp salt
1 stick @danishcreamery butter
1/4 cup maple syrup
2 eggs 

Filling:
1 apple, chopped
1 cup cherries
1 cup cranberries 
Juice of 1 lemon
Pinch salt
Thumb ginger 
1/2 stick @danishcreamery butter 

Mix all filling ingredients together and cook on low on the stove top. While that is cooking, mix dough together and roll out. Once your filling is tender, fill the dough and fold the sides over! Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes. 

#DanishCreamery #SpreadGenerously #SavorSlowly #DanishCreameryHoliday

Follow @holisticrendezvous for hormone supportive recipes and healthy treats! 

This drinks focuses on ingredients that support your hormones and your immune system! Cranberries are naturally high in antioxidants that can support the immune system. Cranberries also anti- inflammatory and supportive of detoxification, so this drink can be beneficial all throughout your hormonal cycle! 

Ice cubes:
Cranberries
Orange or clementine
Rosemary
Diluted cranberry juice or plain water 

Drink recipe (serves 2):
2 oz. cranberry juice concentrate
1/4 tsp ginger
1/4 tsp cinnamon 
Pinch cardamom
Pinch salt
Optional: Turkey tail tincture (a medicinal mushroom that is great for immunity) 
1 can sparkling water 

Rim:
Propolis honey and coconut sugar

Are these not the cutest cookies you’ve ever seen?!?

Cranberry noses and chocolate antlers 🥰

Ingredients:
1.5 cups almond flour
1/2 cup cassava flour
1/2 cup arrowroot starch
1 cup coconut sugar
1 tsp salt
1 tsp baking powder
5 Tbsp cinnamon
1 tsp cardamom
3 eggs
1/2 cup butter 
1/4 cup maple syrup 

Topping:
1/4 cup cinnamon
1/4 cup coconut sugar

Preheat oven to 350. Mix all ingredients together and roll into balls. Press the balls down and bake for 15 minutes (depends on the size of cookie). Once cooked, coat in cinnamon sugar mixture. Then use coconut butter or vanilla icing to create a circle on the cookie. Melt chocolate to draw the eyes and antlers and cut a cranberry in half for the nose!

I am begged to make these multiple times per year by many of my people, so you know they are extra delicious. 

These cookies are super easy to throw together! The most time sensitive part is rolling them out by hand😝

Ingredients:
1 cup cassava flour
1/2 cup powdered sugar (+ another 1/4 cup for dipping in) 
3/4 cup chopped pecans
1 stick butter
1 tsp vanilla extract 
Pinch salt 

❄️melt/ soften butter and then combine with all ingredients! Roll into little balls and bake on 350 for 15 minutes. Once out of the oven, coat them in powdered sugar and enjoy! 

*the dough will be crumbly, but you should be able to squeeze it together.

Everything you need for a healthy holiday ✨✨

Apple cider vinegar has many health benefits for gut and immune health, but rosemary is the star here to me! 

Rosemary has anti-inflammatory compounds and antioxidants that boost the immune system, improve blood circulation, and even help with focus and alertness! 

Cranberry and orange also add antioxidants and immune boosting compounds as well for a drink full of holiday cheer! 

Ingredients for shrub:
1 cup water
3/4 cup apple cider vinegar 
1/2 cup honey or maple syrup
One Orange
Large handful Rosemary sprigs (the more the better!)
1/2 cup cranberries 
Pinch salt 

🎄In a pot, combine water, rosemary, orange (juice and skin), cranberries, and salt. Bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 10 minutes. Add in honey and vinegar and stir until honey is dissolved. Strain mixture and put in a jar with the rosemary. 

*make sure not to overheat ACV/ honey because we want to keep in the beneficial enzymes! 
Rosemary Shrub Mocktail:
1-2 oz Rosemary shrub
1/2 cup sparkling water

🎄use cranberry ice cubes, frozen cranberries and a sprig of Rosemary for decoration!

Aren’t these the cutest? I saw these used as a cake topper on Pinterest and knew I had to make them… with a spin of course! 

These are made with gluten free pretzels and no added sugar because I am using coconut butter instead of frosting! I also created the colors by using real food ingredients instead of dyes!

Green- matcha or moringa
Yellow- turmeric 
Blue- blue green algae
Pink- beet powder 

How to make:
Gluten free pretzels
Coconut butter 

Melt coconut butter and mix with desired “color”! Use a piping bag or bottle to zigzag the mixture over a pretzel (make sure to use parchment paper, so it is easy to peel off!). Add dots of colors on top for lights/ ornaments! Then put in the fridge for 5 minutes and they are ready to enjoy! These can be left at room temp and they will not melt!

This gluten free holiday dump cake is the recipe you make when you are low on time and aren’t a baker! It’s really easy and so so delicious! 

Ingredients:
2 heaping cups frozen cherries 
1 heaping cup chopped pineapple
1 box of your favorite cake mix (I used @simplemills vanilla)
1 stick of butter

Dump your fruit together and mix it up. Then pour your dry cake mix over the fruit. Melt your butter and pour it over the top of everything evenly. Bake in the oven at 350 for 20 minutes.

What is your all time favorite sandwich ingredient? Mine is definitely a jam or preserve… and melty cheese 😋

I used @CabotCheese Extra Sharp Cheddar from Whole Foods, roasted chicken (let’s be honest, way better than deli meat), fig jam, mayo, and avocado on sourdough! 

Not only is Cabot cheese delicious, but I also recently found out that @cabotcheese is farmer owned, a certified b corp, award winning, and naturally lactose free! I was so excited to work with them to create this recipe!

Yesterday was the first day of Hanukkah and as a Christmakkah household, we are celebrating! 

You all voted for a blue latte recipe, so I really hope y’all love it! 

Ingredients:

1 tsp blue spirulina powder (mine is from @lonestarbotanicals )

1/2 tbsp honey 
1 tsp vanilla extract
Pinch salt
1/2 cup cashew milk (@elmhurst1925 is bae)
Optional: Pinch glitter because ✨(mine are from @offlimits and have no artificial colors)
 Collagen for protein and gut health!

And then you’ll find the strength of ten Grinches, plus two! ❤️

Please tell me you noticed the tiny heart ice cube! ❤️! This drink has tons of immune boosting ingredients and tastes so delicious! I hope you enjoy it! 

Inspired by : @champagneang and @join_jules 

Ingredients:
1 apple
1 medium sized cucumber
1 jalapeño
Juice of 3 limes
Fresh thyme (a few sprigs)
Pinch salt 
1 cup water
1/4 cup sweetener (honey or I also love allulose for gut health- I did half and half here)
Sparkling water 

🎄Blend all ingredients together, except for the sparkling water and strain. I like using a 2:1 ratio of juice to sparkling water to make the drink. Too with thyme and a dried lime!

I love a cookie that tastes delicious and is super cute, but I can I be honest? I actually liked the cutouts the most out of all of the cookies. The tiny Christmas trees and stars almost felt like dog treats for humans 😂! Is that weird?

Ingredients:
1 1/2 cup almond flour
1/2 cup arrowroot starch
1/2 cup cassava flour 
1 tsp salt
1 tsp baking soda
1 tsp baking powder
1 cup coconut sugar (or allulose) 
1/2 cup butter 
1/2 cup coconut oil 
2 eggs
1 tsp vanilla extract

Mix wet ingredients with sugar, then add in dry ingredients. Place in the fridge if needed for it to firm up so you are able to roll it out. Use cassava flour on the top and bottom while rolling out between parchment paper.Cut out cookie shapes and bake in the oven at 350 for 10 minutes. Fill with your favorite jelly or a homemade chia jam.

🎅Santa asked for warm milk and cookies that won’t cause a sugar crash😂

Ingredients:
1 bag dandelion root tea 
1/2 cup water 
1/2 cup cashew milk
1/2-1 tbsp honey
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
Pinch of: cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, nutmeg, and salt

🎄pour boiling water over tea bag and spices. Once slightly cooled, mix well and top with the cashew milk. I like my milk frothed a little!

I’ve been eating these almond Christmas cookies for a week straight and Santa is one lucky dude! 

If you know you are going to ice these, use half the sweetener. That’s what I did originally and was like big OOPS, but then it ended up being perfect with the sweet icing! (I don’t like things super sweet)

To make the cutie Christmas trees, you’ll need 3 different sized circle cutouts. Cook them and then stack them with icing in between for a christmas tree look! 

Ingredients:
1 1/2 cup almond flour
1/2 cup arrowroot starch
1/2 cup cassava flour 
1 tsp salt
1 tsp baking soda
1 tsp baking powder 
1 cup coconut sugar (or allulose) 
1/2 cup butter 
1/2 cup coconut oil 
2 eggs
1 tsp almond extract

Mix wet ingredients with sugar, then add in dry ingredients. Place in the fridge if needed for it to firm up so you are able to roll it out. Use cassava flour on the top and bottom while rolling out between parchment paper. Cut out cookie shapes and bake in the oven at 350 for 10 minutes. Frost with your favorite frosting. I like @simplemills or you can make your own!

Would you make this?? 

 Recipe:

There are certain goals and specific things I would like to do/ accomplish, but these stick out as overarching themes. 

- nourish my creativity and divine feminine 
- travel + explore more
- saying f* you to imposter syndrome and anxiety
- focus on the people who consistently show up. 
- try something new + out of my comfort zone.

Looking for cycle syncing recipes? Follow @holisticrendezvous for more! 

This pesto is perfect for the first half of your cycle to get in pumpkin seeds to reach your seed cycling goals! 😘 It’s also good for boosting testosterone in men and inspired by a pesto that @elevatedeats.pro and I would make for her athletes! 

Pesto recipe:
1 cup pumpkin seeds
Garlic to your hearts desire
2 big handfuls of basil
1/4 cup nutritional yeast
1+ tsp salt (@redmondrealsalt is 👌🏻)
Olive oil until your desired creaminess (currently loving @getgraza )

✨process all ingredients together until creamy!

Save this to make for brunch this weekend! 

I shared my nut and dairy free pesto recipe with you all yesterday and it is absolutely perfect on this open-faced sandwich! This is a remake of one of my favorite meals from a restaurant in my hometown called the Hot Vegetarian. Shoutout to @sweetbasil_nc in Southern Pines, NC! 

This one is gluten free and can be made completely dairy free if necessary. You can also add a fried egg on top for the perfect brunch! Let’s get into it!

Ingredients:
1 @canyonglutenfree bagel
Seed cycling pesto (recipe shared yesterday)
Mayonnaise (I use @primalkitchenfoods )
Heirloom tomato slices 
Avocado slices
Red onion slices
Cheese (I used a goat cheese from @traderjoes that @sailor_bailey got me hooked on!)

✨Pile all of these ingredients on your bagel, toast until cheese is melty. Then top with pesto (I usually add more olive oil to a little of the pesto to get it drippy!), and fresh basil.

Let’s make an aromatic ginger fizz mocktail! ✨

Kait from @modhippiehabits and Blair from @holisticrendezvous partnered up to create this delicious drink with immune boosting benefits and a party for your taste buds! 

Recipe (Serves 2):
1 Lime, juiced
2 Thumbs Ginger, finely grated 
1/4 Cup Coconut Milk (Blend a can of full fat coconut milk until smooth) 
Pinch of Salt
Top with Sparkling Water
Optional: 1 Tbsp Honey 

For the Mocktail:

Combine the juice of one lime, two thumbs of finely grated ginger, a quarter cup of blended coconut milk, and a pinch of salt and mix well to combine. Optional: add honey to sweeten! Use a lime to wet the rims of two glasses and dip in sea salt mixed with lime zest. Fill with ice, and divide the coconut milk mixture between the two and top with sparkling water. 

The Garnishes:

Dehydrated Lime Swirl
Dehydrated Ginger Slice
Dehydrated Lime Slice
Lime Salt Rim

Using a sharp knife in a circular motion, remove the entire peel of a lime in one strip, move slowly and be patient! Remove any excess pith, then slice in half, longways to create two swirls. If using a dehydrator pin the lime strands to a wooden dowel or spoon and twirl around leaving space between each twist, pin the bottom to secure, and dehydrate on the fruit setting for eight hours. If you’re using an oven, use oven safe materials- a metal straw and baker’s twine work well! Dehydrate 1-2 hours on your oven’s lowest setting. 

Lime salt (zest mixed with sea salt), ginger slices, and lime slices, can all be dehydrated at the same time as your swirl!

Apple cider vinegar has many health benefits for gut and immune health, but rosemary is the star here! 

Rosemary has anti-inflammatory compounds and antioxidants that boost the immune system, improve blood circulation, and even help with focus and alertness!

Ingredients for shrub:
1 cup water
3/4 cup apple cider vinegar 
1/2 cup honey or maple syrup
One Orange
Large handful Rosemary sprigs (the more the better!)
1/2 cup cranberries 
Pinch salt 

✨In a pot, combine water, rosemary, orange (juice and skin), cranberries, and salt. Bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 10 minutes. Add in honey and vinegar and stir until honey is dissolved. Strain mixture and put in a jar with the rosemary. 

*make sure not to overheat ACV/ honey because we want to keep in the beneficial enzymes! 
Rosemary Shrub Mocktail:
1-2 oz Rosemary shrub
1/2 cup sparkling water

✨use cranberry ice cubes, frozen cranberries and a sprig of Rosemary for decoration!

✨Dry January is coming to a close and I think it’s a good time to reflect on intentions and reassess our WHY behind the choices we make.

*my goal here is not to ostracize anyone or to call anyone out, solely to have us think a little deeper! 
I obviously had a whole dry January series to give inspiration! 

I know many of you are here for my mocktail recipes, which will continue coming because I love a fancy drink with health benefits, but I also thought this would be a good time to chat about alcohol and intentionality as a whole. 

In all things in my life, I strive for balance and freedom, so I rarely look at things through a dogmatic lens… though if you know me IRL, I am very opinionated😂! 

I have never been a huge drinker and have always had just as much fun going out with or without alcohol. It has never been a huge priority to me, BUT, I also enjoy getting a little tipsy from time to time. Cue Tipsy by j-Kwon.  To me, this is just a normal and healthy relationship with alcohol. 

It’s very trendy right now to cut out alcohol, which I do love, because I believe our society as a whole could have a much healthier relationship with alcohol. However, I don’t love labels because I think many times they are used as a way to boast superiority. No thanks. And a lot of times it comes with an all or nothing mentality that doesn’t equate to success. 

Here’s what we know. Alcohol isn’t great for our hormones and can promote excess estrogen. Alcohol can also impair our sleep, gut health, increase anxiety, and more. BUT it is also something that is present in most cultures… we even think elephants get drunk from time to time! So, yeah, I personally believe their can be a place for healthyish alcohol consumption. 

So anyways, I’m curious what your thoughts are on this sobriety movement, your relationship with alcohol, and just your overall opinions on this topic! 

Remember, you don’t have to label your relationship with or without alcohol, just do what is right for you! Consume what you want to consume based on your intentions and goals.

This is a rendition of a love C tea I used to make when I was interning at an herbal shop and it is still my favorite tea of all time. Im going to give y’all the OG recipe and the optional additions that I added for an extra kick! 

The OG tea recipe uses 3 ingredients that create a killer combination; hibiscus (1 part), rose hips (1 part), and rose petals (1/4 part). 

Hibiscus tea has been touted for its ability to reduce blood pressure as well as for its high levels of antioxidants which support our bodies in so many ways…from keeping you looking young, improving your immunity, and lowering inflammation.

Rose Hips tea is#extremely high in vitamin C and vitamin A. Vitamin A keeps your skin glowing and improves wound healing. Vitamin A is also great for the immune system along with the vitamin C.

Rose Petals add a subtle flavor that makes this tea. They are also rich in vitamin C, polyphenols, and other antioxidants that improve health!

In the video I used 1 tbsp rosehips, 1 tbsp hibiscus, 1 tsp rose petals, and then I added in 1 tsp of nettle and 1 thumb of chopped ginger! This was for 16 oz. If water, which made a super strong overnight infusion. 

An overnight infusion differs from a tea because it is stronger. You use more herb and allow it to sit overnight to get super concentrated. I heated my teapot up the next AM and added it to my warm lemon water, but you can also use it to flavor water throughout the day!

When your low waste lifestyle is aesthetic.

I use a LOT of citrus. Warm lemon water every morning, lemon in my tea, citrus in mocktails/elixirs, etc., so when my friend Kait ( @modhippiehabits ) brought me over lime salt I knew I had to start making my own. This recipe used to be one of my favorite desserts/ snacks to make for myself to have on hand and I think it’s time we bring them back! 

Recipe:
2 cups coconut shreds OR 1 cup coconut butter
3 cups strawberries
½ cup walnuts
½ cup sprouted sunflower seeds
½ cup sprouted pumpkin seeds
¼ cup flax seeds
pinch sea salt

Blend or process walnuts, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, flax, and salt until it sticks together when you pinch it.
* you may need to add a little bit of coconut oil and honey 
Next process the strawberries and coconut butter together. 
Press the nut and seed mixture down, then top with the strawberry mixture, freeze, and enjoy.

Helping hot girls with stomach issues become hot girls with happy bellies drinking tea! 

I asked my acupuncturist for her favorite TCM herbs for gut health and had to share this tea with you all courtesy of Layne @onyxacu !

This herbal tea blend combines peppermint, fennel, and dried tangerine peel to support, strengthen, and calm the digestive organs in times of tummy aches, nausea or light digestive upset. 

Peppermint, a cooling herb, is wonderful for relieving digestive cramping, calming acid reflux and easing a “stress stomach”

Fennel is great for reducing gas and bloating and can even be used in parasite treatments.

Dried tangerine peel is a harmonizing herb for the formula, meaning it not only strengthens and regulates the energy or qi of the digestive organs, but it also moderates and balances the formula for the best effects from all herbs

These herbs have been used in traditional Chinese medicine for over 3000 years and continue to support us today!

Tea recipe:
2 parts peppermint
1 part fennel
1 part tangerine peel 
 *to make your own, grate the skin off of your tangerine and place in a dehydrator or in your oven at the lowest setting for 1-2 hours. 

Parts could be 1 tbsp, 1/4 cup, etc based on how much of this tea blend you want to make! 

Use 1/2 tbsp for 8 oz. water.

Teaming up with my friend, herbalist, and the best aesthetician @stratumaesthetics for this tea that heals your skin from the inside out! 

I asked her to create the best tea for glowing skin and this tea checks every box: gut, liver, and lymph support, blood sugar balancing aspects, and a healthy dose of nutrients!

🍌Plantain: the ultimate gut heal herb, this should be a star in any skin support tea because if the gut lining isn’t in tact, you will almost always see it in the skin. 

Marshmallow: Another gut healing plant, marshmallow coats the lining of the stomatch and intestinses to sooth and heal.  This plant also helps to better hydrate and help with regular digestion, which is essential for healthy skin!

🌼Calendula: Also powerful for gut healing, calendula is a beautiful lymphatic tonic helping to carry away stagnat waste so that fresh new fluid can flow below the skin. When the lymph system is working properly skin is more clear, brighter, and less puffy.

🍓Schisandra: Sometimes called beauty berry, the potent antioxidants in schisandra help to protect the skin from damage and supporting the integrity of collagen and elastin. This five flavor berry protects the liver and helps it to repair from damage, this helps it to function! 

Cinnamon: A fantastic herb for balancing blood sugar, when the blood sugar is spiking over and over and over this can lead to collagen break down, sagging skin, dry skin, and acne.

🌹Rose Hip: One of the highest vitamin C rich plants you can find, this is helpful for skin because vitamin C is the co-factor needed to produce collagen.  Rose hip also helps to protect against skin damage while reducing inflammation. 

Recipe:
Plantain 1 part 
Calendula 1/2 part
Schisandra 1 part
Rose hip 1 part
Cinnamon chips 1 part
Marshmallow root 1 part

Use 1/2 tbsp per 8 oz of water. You can also do an overnight infusion if you’d like!

Your perfect luteal phase side kick! This recipe uses sunflower seed butter for some #seedcycling benefits and obviously chocolate to fulfill those cravings. 

Seed cycling is the practice of eating specific seeds during the first and second half of your hormonal cycle. Your cycle is broken into four phases, menstrual, follicular, ovulatory, and luteal, but menstrual and follicular are considered the first part of your cycle and ovulatory and luteal are considered the second half. 

During the luteal phase (or second half of your cycle) you consume sunflower seeds and sesame seeds to promote progesterone, which is a relaxation hormone. 

Ingredients:
1/2 cup dark chocolate chips (I used @enjoylifefoods )
1 tbsp coconut oil
1/2 cup sunflower seed butter (I used @sunbutter )
4 dates
Big pinch flaky sea salt 
Optional: 2 scoops collagen and 1/4 cup gluten free pretzels (I used @fitjoy )

✨melt chocolate with coconut oil in a double broiler. Place in your mold and freeze. Then, process sunbutter, salt, collagen, and dates together. Put into chocolate mold on top of hardened chocolate. Add in pretzels for crunch. Finally, too with the rest of your chocolate and freeze again!

If you needed an excuse to make yourself a fancy drink, this is it!

Did you know that apple cider vinegar before a meal can help with blood sugar balance and in turn hormone health? 

That’s why I make functional elixirs/ mocktails that actually have benefits! 

The shrub mocktails that I make contain apple cider vinegar, which has been shown to help with blood sugar balance when consumed before a meal (especially a heavier carb meal). This is due to the acetic acid, which helps our muscles use glucose more efficiently, in turn lowering blood sugar levels. 

This could be super helpful for someone with PCOS, insulin resistance, etc. but isn’t a substitute for consuming balanced meals!

I really thought about calling these leprechaun poop, but I guess that doesn’t sound appetizing😝, so I swerved! 

I love that these are full of healthy fats, antioxidants, and are refined sugar free! Plus they are beautiful and a perfect #stpatricksday treat! 

Recipe:
1/4 cup cacao butter
1/4 cup tahini
2 tbsp honey 
Pinch salt
1-2 tbsp matcha (depending on your taste buds!)
1/4 cup raspberries 
1/2 tbsp chia seeds

🍀Melt cacao butter and then add in tahini, salt, honey, and matcha. Stir until combined then place a small amount in a mold. While that hardens, mash together raspberries, chia seeds, and a pinch of salt. I used frozen raspberries and heated to combine. You also have the option of adding a little honey. Add a a small amount into the mold and then top with more of the matcha mixture. Allow to harden in refrigerator and enjoy!

The most beautiful donuts you ever did see! And they are gluten, dairy, and nut free for my bebes! 

And yes, these make me smile… they are just so aesthetically and taste bud pleasing! 

Recipe:
1/2 cup cassava flour
1/4 cup arrowroot starch 
1/3 cup allulose
1 tsp salt
1 tsp baking soda
1 tsp baking powder 
1 tbsp dragonfruit powder (mine is from @nature.restore )
3 eggs (obsessed with @vitalfarms restorative eggs)
1/4 cup applesauce ( I love @whiteleafprovisions )
1/4 cup thawed raspberries ( chop if you need- smaller pieces are best) 
Zest and juice of 1 lemon 
1 tsp vanilla extract

One thing I will never do, is let that inner voice of doubt define me or control me. I know I’m not the only person that has experienced these types of thoughts and I can assure you they aren’t there to help you or push you to be better. Those thoughts are there to keep you small; to keep you from expanding and creating in a way that will push you out of your comfort zone. 

While these voices may sneak up on you from time to time, it’s how you show up for yourself even when they get loud that defines you. 

If I had listened to these voices, I wouldn’t have pursued a nutrition science degree, a holistic nutrition certification, becomes a fitness instructor, created a thriving online community, accepted the love from my partner, and SO many other things. 

So moral of the story, don’t allow your doubts or insecurities to stop you from pushing forward with your passions. Your unique voice is needed and you will slowly push the negative voice out by re-writing your own script!

Which one are you drinking right now?! 

During the menstrual phase you want warming drinks that are anti-inflammatory and loaded with nutrients. The “hot toddy” recipe I created checks all of these boxes! 

During the follicular phase, you want to focus on fresh foods that feel energizing and light. I cannot think of anything better than a kiwi, lime, + mint mojito which is refreshing and a great source of antioxidants and vitamin C. 

During the ovulatory phase it is important to focus on foods that are high in antioxidants and liver supportive to aid in estrogen detoxification. I love the strawberry pomegranate limeade because it is refreshing and loaded with antioxidants to support detoxification. Plus you leave the fruit pulp in for a little extra fiber.

During the luteal phase blood sugar isn’t as balanced, so I chose the raspberry mandarin shrub for this phase because the apple cider vinegar can help with balanced blood sugar. It is also high in vitamin C, which is helpful for making progesterone. Progesterone is one of the female sex hormones that is important in the second half of our cycle to maintain the uterine lining if there is a pregnancy, pretty cool eh? A proper balance of progesterone also helps with PMS!

The POG mocktail because I REALLY want to go to Hawaii and swim with sea turtles. 

While in San Diego a few months ago I had a POG flavored drink and didn’t know what it was, but thought it was delicious. Around the same time my acupuncturist ( @onyxacu )had gone to Hawaii and said POG drinks were huge there, so of course I had to make it! 

Also, if you want a cocktail version, I basically forced @yellowbellykelly to make it because I knew she would make it look insanely gorgeous. She did not disappoint. 

This would also be a phenomenal drink to make a batch of for a party since it is equal parts orange juice, guava juice, and passion fruit juice. Then you just top with sparkling water! I of course added in some fresh passion fruit and coconut cream, but it’s absolutely delicious without as well! 

Recipe:
1 oz. orange juice (I made some in my juicer)
1 oz. guava juice 
1 oz. passion fruit juice
1 passion fruit 
Sparkling water
1 oz. coconut cream

Combine orange, passion fruit, and guava juice with 1 passion fruit. Pour over ice and add an equal amount of sparkling water. Float the coconut cream on top with more passion fruit and enjoy!

If you haven’t made Brazilian lemonade yet, then this is your sign! 

@carolinagelen posted a viral video of this recipe and I knew I had to make a dairy free version for you guys! Plus we added electrolytes because summer is coming and we gotta stay happy, healthy, and hydrated! 

Recipe:
3 limes, cut into pieces
3 cups water 
1/3 cup sweetened condensed coconut milk
Lots of ice! 

✨Blend the water and limes together, pulsing until roughly blended. Remember if you blend for too long, it will get bitter! Strain this mixture and then blend it wi th coconut condensed milk, a large pinch of mineral salt, and lots of ice! Blend until frothy and smooth! I went for a watered down slushee texture! Serve right away in chilled glasses and garnish with a dehydrated lime slice!

If you’re looking for ways to add in more flavor and nutrients to your day, then look no further than a delicious herbal syrup! This has become one of my favorite ways to uplevel my drinks and add in some medicinal herbs and foods! 

Honey Ginger Syrup Recipe:
1 cup water
1/2 cup sliced ginger
1/3 cup honey 

First, clean your ginger by chopping off any bad pieces and giving it a bath in a vinegar water mixture! Rinse it off and chop into pieces. Combine your ginger with the water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, bring down to a simmer for 15 minutes. Then turn off the heat and let the syrup cook for another 10-15 minutes before adding in the honey. You still want the water to be warm so it dissolves, but not hot since that will take some of the beneficial components out of the honey! Next, blend the mixture and strain into a container. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks! 

Pinneaple Ginger Fizz Mocktail Recipe:
1 oz ginger syrup
1 oz pineapple juice (@traderjoes has a phenomenal one in the refrigerated section! )
Sparkling water
Optional: 2 sprigs Rosemary
Optional: 1/2 oz apple cider vinegar 

If using Rosemary, muddle Rosemary, pineapple, and ginger syrup together. Then, strain over ice and top with sparkling water. Garnish with more rosemary and enjoy!

Happy birthday to my favorite sister @nataliejforte ! I’ve got a bag for you in the freezer for when you visit in a couple weeks! 

Crust:
½ cup almonds
½ cup brazil nuts
½ cup sunflower seeds
2 tbsps coconut oil
1 tbsp + 1 tsp honey
large pinch sea salt
Sweet Potato Filling:
1-2 sweet potatoes, cooked (a little over a cup)
1 cup soaked cashew
¼ cup water
pinch sea salt
Caramel:
10 dates
2 tbsps almond butter
1 tsp ghee
1 tbsp maple syrup or honey
1 tsp coarse ground sea salt (or more to taste)
½ cup date water
2 tbsp gelatin

Crust:
Soak nuts/ seeds overnight (not necessary if you are in a bind!)
Blend all ingredients together until sticky (doesn’t need to be super smooth!)
Press into a square on a piece of parchment paper.
Sweet Potato Filling:
Soak cashews overnight and drain
Blend cashews with sweet potatoes, water, and sea salt!
Spread over the crust smoothly.
Caramel:
De-seed dates and soak overnight.
Remove the dates from water, but keep the date water for blending.
Combine all ingredients and blend until smooth!
Spread caramel over the top of the sweet potato filling.
NEXT...
Freeze the three layers.
Once hard, melt your favorite chocolate (we love lilly’s or enjoy life) or use our base raw chocolate recipe.
Then, Pour over top to create a chocolate crust.
Lastly, cut and ENJOY! We like to keep these frozen in the freezer, but they can also be kept in the fridge for a softer texture!

Mango matcha mochi is the treat of the summer, I don’t make the rules! 

I learned to make mochi in my natural chef program in 2013, which was before @traderjoes started selling the ice cream version that took us all by storm. At that time, I was excited because this was a naturally gluten free dessert that wasn’t overly sweet and was fairly easy to make (albeit quite messy). 

Fast forward to today, I saw @nom_life make mango mochi and I knew I had to try it, but with a twist! 

Recipe:
2 ripe mangos
1 cup glutinous rice flour (I used @anthonysgoods )
1/3 cup allulose or sugar
2 tbsps matcha (I used @jadeleafmatcha )
1 cup water 

✨combine dry ingredients and mix. Then add in your water and stir until combined. Heat in the microwave for 3 minutes OR heat on the stove on medium heat for 7-10 minutes, stirring. It should firm up, but will still be quite stuck. Use tapioca starch to roll out the dough and then cut your mango. Wrap the mango in the mochi and enjoy! 
* I stored the leftover wrapped mangos in the freezer and allow them to thaw before consuming!

Growing up, my grandma ALWAYS made me a strawberry shortcake for my birthday and that was my all time favorite dessert. BUT dark chocolate flourless cake has taken over as a fav since you pretty much never find strawberry shortcake on a dessert menu… and it wouldn’t be the same as Mammoo’s anyways! 

This dark chocolate flourless cake is gluten free and dairy free and still absolutely fudgy and delicious! 

Recipe: 
3 eggs
½ cup melted coconut oil
⅓ cup maple syrup
½ cup dark chocolate chips
½ cup cacao powder
1 cup finely chopped cauliflower
¼ cup coconut flour
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 tsp sea salt

✨Preheat oven to 300 degrees
Steam cauliflower
Separate egg yolks and whites and then whip the whites until soft peaks form.
Melt dark chocolate chips and coconut oil and mix with maple syrup, vanilla extract, and sea salt.
Blend steamed cauliflower until creamy and then mix with the egg yolks and all of the other ingredients except the egg whites.
Then fold in the egg whites.
Coat spring form pan with coconut oil and then tap in a light coating of coconut flour so that the cake easily comes out!
Finally, place in a spring form pan and bake for 45 minutes!
Once done, I like to cool in the refrigerator before serving! 

* in this video I topped with a raspberry compote, which was just frozen raspberries heated up on the stovetop with a squeeze of lemon and chia seeds. I didn’t measure any of this, sorry!

Recipe:
Juice or 1 lime 
1/2 oz ginger honey syrup (recipe on my page) 
1 dropper herbal bitters (I used @peace.love.hormones by my cutie friend @themaddiemiles )
Pinch salt
Pinch activated charcoal 
Sparkling water

Lavender maple syrup:
1 cup maple syrup
1/4 cup food grade lavender

Recipe: 
3 eggs
1/2 cup lavender maple syrup 
1 tbsp vanilla extract
1/2 cup cassava flour
1/2 cup almond flour
1 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt 
 
✨Mix wet ingredients together, then add in dry ingredients. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Timing will depend on the size of your donut molds. Dip into frosting and top with lavender or edible flowers! 

Icing:
1/2 cup lavender maple syrup
1 stick room temperature butter 
Pinch salt 
1 tsp vanilla extract 
✨I’m not a traditional baker so I just melt everything together and mix. I put in the freezer/ refrigerator until it is the texture I want, mixing in between.

I finally made an erewhon style glazed smoothie and I get the hype! This stress reducing strawberry glazed smoothie is everything I could hope for in a smoothie (tart, sweet, creamy, high in nutrients and stress reducing properties.) AD I made this smoothie with two different stress reducing herbs from @vimergy , ashwagandha and lemon balm! 

I’m a huge fan of using adaptogens, especially in liquid form, because they are easy to add into recipes and help me respond more calmly to the stressors of the day. These herbal tinctures from @vimergy actually taste good and they are triple third party tested for purity, so you know exactly what you are getting. 

Both of these herbs are clinically researched and tested for their ability to support the body’s natural stress response, so they are a perfect addition to this smoothie to help you deal with the stress of the day! 

Recipe (glazed portion):
1 lemon
1/4 cup frozen raspberries 
1/4 cup frozen strawberries 
Pinch salt
1 dropper @vimergy lemongrass tincture

zest the lemon into your blender. Then peel your lemon and add the interior of the lemon into the blender along with raspberries, strawberries, salt, and @vimergy lemongrass. Blend until smooth and creamy. 

Recipe (creamy portion):
1 banana
1/2 cup frozen strawberries 
1/2 cup milk of choice 
2 droppers @vimergy ashwagandha tincture
Optional: vanilla protein powder 

add all ingredients to the blender and blend until smooth. 

add coconut cream to the sides of your glass, then pour a little of each smoothie portion to the glass until full. Enjoy!

Rhubarb season is here and this rhubarb syrup is a super fun way to use fresh or frozen rhubarb! 

This syrup is a beautiful addition to cocktails and mocktails, but I love that after straining, the fruit pulp still tastes amazing and can easily be added to yogurt bowls, chia jam, etc. 

When I make shrub mocktails, I prefer to add in straight apple cider vinegar to a syrup or muddled fruit because it’s easy…and I like to keep things as simple and easy as I can! BUT you could also make a rhubarb shrub by soaking the rhubarb in vinegar for a few days! 

Rhubarb syrup: 
12 oz frozen or fresh rhubarb
1 cup water
1/2 cup sweetener of choice (sugar, honey, allulose, etc)

Rosemary Rhubarb Shrub:
1 oz. rhubarb syrup
1 tbsp apple cider vinegar 
Lots of rosemary! 
Sparkling water 
✨Make the syrup and then muddle rosemary and rhubarb syrup together. Add ACV, pour over ice, and top with sparkling water. 
Tip: I love adding in rosemary to the syrup to get a deeper flavor than just muddling!

Butterfly pea flower may be one of my favorite ingredients because it makes the most simple drink seem super fancy, magical, and elegant. In this drink I used @animamundiherbals butterfly pea flower powder, which easily mixes in water for a quick way to add this flower to any recipe. 

In Ayurveda, this flower is most known for its brain boosting properties, but is also anti- inflammatory, great for the skin and eyes, aids in digestion and stabilizes blood sugar levels. It’s basically ‘steeped’ in health benefits, symbolism, and history! Seriously, read about it’s used and meanings throughout different cultures. 

Recipe:
Juice of 1 lemon
1 tsp honey
Pinch salt 
Fresh ginger, grated
Sparkling water
1/4 tsp butterfly pea flower powder from @animamundiherbals 
1/4 cup water 
✨mix lemon juice, salt, grated ginger (just a pinch)and honey and pour in a glass. Top with ice and pour over the sparkling water. Stir butterfly pea flower powder into the water and pour on top. Stir for the color changing magic!

Don’t ask me how this tastes like root beer to me, but for some reason it does😝! But I also hate root beer and like this, so maybe I’m just confused. 

@withlaurenrussell requested this flavor profile on her recent trip to visit me, so we had to make it happen! I love that the lime syrup is made with the zest, so you are truly using every part of the lime. I juiced the limes afterwards for other mocktails and used the strained bits of the lime syrup to make lime sugar for beautiful and tasty sugared rims! 

Lime Syrup:
1/4 cup lime zest
1 cup water 
1/2 cup sweetener of choice
✨zest limes and then bring all ingredients to a simmer for 15 minutes. Allow to cool and then strain. Keep the lime zest and mix it with granulated sugar. Dry in the oven for 2 hours at 175 degrees and use for drink rims! 

Mint syrup:
1 cup water 
1/2 cup maple syrup 
1 cup fresh mint 
✨ Bring all ingredients to a boil and then turn down to a simmer for 15 minutes. Allow to cool and strain! 

Drink recipe (serves 2-3):
1 oz lime syrup
1/2 oz mint syrup
1 oz coconut cream (can of full fat coconut cream, blended)
Sparkling water 
🍹mix all ingredients together and pour over ice. Garnish with a lime zest and sugar salt rim, fresh mint, and edible flowers

You have to make this tajin salmon dish with a watermelon and cucumber salad using @vitalchoice MSC Certified sustainable salmon! AD

MSC Certified Sustainable Seafood means @vitalchoice products meet all three principles of the MSC Fisheries Standard: to sustain wild seafood stocks, to use catch methods that have minimal environmental impact, and to demonstrate effective fishery management.

This is extremely important to me as I always try to vote with my dollar and purchase sustainably. Small choices like your buying habits add up, so I focus on things that I can have some control over! 

FISHWITHBLAIR offers 15% off of all orders!

Recipe (marinade/dressing):
2 tbsps lime juice
2 tbsps olive oil
1 tsp tajin
1 tbsp honey

Recipe (tajin honey):
1/4 cup honey
1 tsp tajin
1 tsp garlic granules
1 tsp onion granules

✨preheat oven to 450, then make the marinade/ dressing and use half to marinate salmon ( I used three 6 ounce filets of @vitalchoice salmon cut into bite size chunks). Roast the salmon for 10 minutes. While roasting, heat the honey and add in spices. Pour over the salmon and broil for 5 minutes. Tajin watermelon and cucumber salad recipe: 
2 cups watermelon, diced

Recipe:
1 cup+ yogurt (I love greek @nancysyogurt)
1 cup pineapple
1 banana
1 tsp blue spirulina, divided (mine is @lonestarbotanicals )

✨blend banana, pineapple, greek yogurt, and 1/2 tsp blue spirulina until creamy. Smear extra greek yogurt into your popsicle molds and the sprinkle with the blue spirulina. A tablespoon of hydrated chia seeds a day, keeps the bloating away! Chia seeds are my hack for defeating shy bowels while traveling and this recipe makes you want to get them in! 

Chia seeds are super high in fiber and when soaked in water, or in this case, cashew milk, they swell and have a mucilaginous property, which is why they plump and get slimy and thick! This also makes them hydrating, which is why I always recommend eating hydrated chia seeds so that they don’t have the opposite effect in your body! 

I will also take magnesium citrate and make sure to stay hydrated with plenty of electrolytes because ya girl does not play with travel constipation! 

Recipe:
1/4 cup chia seeds
1 cup cashew milk (I love @elmhurst1925 )
1/2 cup greek yogurt
1 super ripe mango
Optional: granola (I love @purely_elizabeth )
✨combine chia seeds and liquid and shake. Place in the fridge until thick. Depending on your chia seeds, this could happen super quickly or quite slowly. Overnight is your best bet! Top with yogurt, mango, and granola for a crunch! 

#chiaseedpudding #hormonalhealth #balancedbloodsugar #balancedhormones #digestivehealth #cyclesyncing

This recipe shocked me in the best way! I’ve been making it a point to try to use all of the seasonal fruit in a mocktail recipe this summer and cantaloupe didn’t disappoint. I even made a slushee version that I’ll be sharing soon as well! 

But seriously, don’t skip trying this one. I probably wouldn’t have if I saw it on a menu, but I’m so glad I gave it a try! 

Recipe: (serves2)
1-2 cups cantaloupe (about 4 oz juice) 
2 limes, juiced (about 2 oz)
Pinch salt 
Sparkling water 

✨start by zesting your limes. Combine your lime zest with Maldon salt and set aside. Cut a cantaloupe and blend 1-2 cups of it and strain. This will depend on the juiciness of your cantaloupe. You want to end up with 4 oz of juice for 2 servings. Juice your limes and combine with cantaloupe juice and a pinch of salt. Pour over ice and top with sparkling water. 
For the rim I used honey and the lime salt!

FOURTH OF JULY STRAWBERRY PRETZEL SALAD PARFAITS! 

My grandma would always make this “salad” for family get togethers in the summer, but I haven’t had it in years. So of course I set out to make a gluten free version! 

I also decided to make this into a parfait because I wanted the topping to be super crunchy! I hope y’all enjoy! 

If you’re vegan, leave out the cottage cheese layer and check out @unboundwellness recipe for Sicilian watermelon pudding and use that as your base recipe, but with strawberries! 

Crust recipe:
2 cups GF pretzels ( I love @quinnsnacks )
1 stick butter (I love @vitalfarms )
3 tbsps sugar
✨Melt butter and combine ingredients together. Toast in the oven for 10 minutes at 350. 

Gelatin layer:
1 cup water 
1 cup strawberries 
2 tbsps gelatin ( I used @vitalproteins beef gelatin)
Optional: sweetener 

✨Blend strawberries and water until smooth. Pour over gelatin and let bloom. Then heat on medium until fully dissolved. Refrigerate in desired cups or pan and place in fridge to set. * if you use a pan, you will just cut jello and place in cups later. 

Other ingredients:
1 cup cottage cheese, blended (I love @good_culture )
@so_delicious coco whip
Strawberries and blueberries, chopped

In your cups, layer in your gelatin, blended cottage cheese (option to add sweetener to this layer), fruit, coco whip, and pretzel topping. Enjoy!

Did you know that you could use mango scraps to make syrup?? It’s the perfect addition to this Mango Matcha Latte!

PASSIONFRUIT MOJITO MOCKTAIL! The perfect drink to uplift your mood! It’s visually stunning and contains mood boosting and balancing herbals! 

You all know I love butterfly pea flower by now for its benefits and color changing abilities. I love using it here for its ability to balance the body and calm and soothe the nervous system! 

The euphoria extract uses herbs that traditionally uplift the spirit and support healthy moods! I love this combo for summer because too much Yang (fire energy) can lead to anger, but on the positive side can also bring lots of joy! 

Recipe:
4 oz passionfruit juice 
1 lime, juiced 
4-5 mint leaves 
1/2 cup water
1/4 tsp @animamundiherbals butterfly pea flower 
1 tsp @animamundiherbals euphoria
Sparkling water 

✨combine passionfruit juice (I found pure juice at a local H mart), like and mint, muddle. Pour ice over it and add a touch of sparkling water. Then combine water, butterfly pea flower, and euphoria. Pour on top and enjoy! If you want a sweeter flavor, add honey!

Hibiscus and tajin are a match made in heaven and you can’t tell me otherwise. 

Hibiscus is one of my favorite herbal teas because it is so flavorful, but I also love that it is loaded with vitamin C, has anti inflammatory benefits, and is known for its ability to lower blood pressure. 

Recipe (serves 2)
1 tbsp hibiscus
1 cup water 
3 oz grapefruit juice 
1 oz lime juice 
Jalapeño slices
Pinch salt 
2 tsp honey 
Sparkling water 

✨Boil your water and pour over dried hibiscus. Allow to steep overnight in the fridge or at least 10 minutes. Combine the rest of your ingredients and muddle. Strain and pour over ice, then top with sparkling water. I used honey and tajin for the rim and garnished with a lime and grapefruit slice.

When your low waste lifestyle is aesthetic.

I use a LOT of citrus. Warm lemon water every morning, lemon in my tea, citrus in mocktails/elixirs, etc., so when my friend Kait ( @modhippiehabits ) brought me over lime salt I knew I had to start making my own. It’s not only delicious on seafood, but PERFECT for an aesthetic salt rim on your drinks! 

Plus the peels of citrus have tons of bioflavanoids and vitamin C, so you’re getting a little something extra! 

Instructions:
Microplane citrus and then add salt. Yes, that’s it. You can do it in whatever amounts you want based on your taste preference and how strong you want it to be. 
Then dry it out in your oven at 175 degrees (or your ovens lowest setting) for 1-2 hours! 

* I added rose petals to the orange salt because I’m *extra*

Thankfully, these rice paper roll ups did the trick for me! Also, was I the only person who went through a McDonald’s apple pie phase back in 2004? 

Recipe:
Thinly sliced apples (I used honey crisp)
Honey
Ginger 
Cinnamon
Salt 
Rice paper
Water

Recipe (makes 2):

1 thumb ginger

This ✨Heart Opening Tonic✨ is full of vitamin C and antioxidants to keep you happy and healthy with the changing seasons! 

I am so excited to partner with @whatiffoods to create this mocktail to celebrate climate week. @whatiffoods is committed to soil health and carbon sequestration through regenerative farming. All of their products use regenerative agriculture, which is like a superhero for the climate. It helps the soil become healthier and better at grabbing and storing carbon from the air, while also creating a richer environment for plants to grow. That means fewer harmful chemicals, which helps the planet by reducing pollution AND less greenhouse gases. 

Plus their milk has only 3 ingredients, is a good source of protein and fiber, and it contains no added sugar, gums, or stabilizers! 

Recipe:
1/2 tablespoon rosehips
1/2 tablespoon rose
1 cup water
1/3 cup strawberries
2 oz @whatiffoods bamnut milk
1/2 oz lime juice
1/2 tbsp honey
Pinch salt
Steep rosehips and rose in 1 cup hot water. Allow to sit for 10 minutes. Blend Strawberries, lime juice, honey, salt, and bamnut milk with the tea mixture. Pour over ice and garnish with strawberry hearts! If you want it to be super smooth, you can strain it after blending! 

#Regeneration #BAMNnut #PlanetBased #BAMnutMilkMocktail #mocktails #mocktailrecipe #sobermovement #sobercurious

✨GUT HEALING PUMPKIN SPICE MARHSMALLOWS✨ for this girl who is in fact, a summer. But tomorrow is the first day of autumn, so it’s time for me to embrace the fall girl aesthetic and flavors! 

These homemade marshmallows have two gut healing ingredients: gelatin and marshmallow root. Marshmallow root is a tea that is great for numerous digestive issues and has mucilagenic properties that may soothe the lining of the stomach! 

Gelatin may also help restore the gut lining and enhance digestive strength! And I know some of y’all aren’t down with gelatin, so use a substitute if it’s not for you 🫶

Gut Healing Pumpkin Spice Marshmallows:
1 cup water 
1/2 cup maple syrup 
1 tbsp marshmallow root
3 tbsps grass fed gelatin
1 tsp pumpkin pie spice 
Pinch salt 
✨Pour 1 cup hot water over marshmallow root. Allow to steep until cool. Strain and place in a pot. Pour the gelatin over the tea to bloom. Then heat this mixture so that the gelatin dissolved and add in spices and maple syrup. Remove from heat and use a stand or hand mixer to mix until stiff peaks form. This took about ten minutes. Quickly pour into a parchment lined container and let set. Cut into squares. Option to toss in arrowroot starch and more pumpkin spice!

The last time I ate eggs I sh*t my pants, so our current relationship status is: on a break.

💀Feliz Dia de Los Muertos! 💀

El Dia De los Muertos or the Day of the Dead is a lively Mexican celebration that not only honors deceased ancestors, but is also a great reminder that death is just a normal part of life. 

My elementary school celebrated every year and I always thought it was such a beautiful celebration to honor our family members that were no longer with us, so of course I had to make us a celebratory drink! 

It uses marigold syrup as marigolds are the iconic flower used to attract souls to the altar during this celebration as well as coffee, corn milk, and orange syrup. Coffee and corn are also traditionally used on the altar as well! 

Recipe:
2 oz coffee (I use @organogold which has reishi spores in it) 
3/4 oz marigold syrup
3/4 oz orange syrup
2 oz sweet corn milk 
Rim: brown sugar (I used coconut sugar) mixed with orange zest

Marigold syrup:
1 cup water 
1/2 cup coconut sugar 
1/4 cup marigold flowers (I used dried) 
✨Combien ingredients and bring to a simmer for 10 minutes. Strain and store in the fridge for up to two weeks. 

Sweet corn Milk:
1 cup sweet corn ( I used frozen and thawed)
2 cups water 
Ping salt 
✨Blend ingredients together and strain. Store in the fridge for up to a week.

🌿@wishgardenherbs liquid bliss tincture: A a unique herbal blend that supports the release of oxytocin and other feel good hormones to promote a fast shift in mood, happiness and connection. Perfect in a mocktail for an uplifted party mood and works great if you have social anxiety or are just in a crap mood. 

🍵Green tea: the caffeine in green tea is uplifting and energizing, but the l-theanine present also helps to calm the nervous system as well, making it a great uplifter without the negative effects of pure caffeine. 

🍓Raspberries: Berries are good mood food because they have high levels of anthocyanins and other polyphenols that boost the release of serotonin and enhance cognitive function! 

Recipe (serves 2):
1/2 cup water
Green tea bag
1/3 cup raspberries 
Juice of 1 lime 
Pinch salt 
2 tsp honey 
8 squirts per drink @wishgardenherbs liquid bliss tincture 
Sparkling water
✨brew tea bag in 1/2 cup water and allow to cool. Combine with all ingredients except for the sparkling water and muddle. Divide between two glasses and pour over ice. Top with sparkling water!

🫚CHAI SIMPLE SYRUP✨ is the best addition to all of your holiday drinks! Whether you are making lattes, mocktails, cocktails, or pouring it over pancakes, you are going to LOVE this syrup! 

The ingredients in chai are extremely supportive for digestion, so I love that this is a twofer in terms of flavor and medicinal benefits! 

**if you don’t want to buy the spices individually, you could a buy chai tea bags and make the syrup that way! 

Recipe:
1 cup water
1/2 cup maple syrup
2 tsp black pepper 
1 tbsp whole cloves 
2 tbsp cardamom pods
1 tbsp fennel
2-3 cinnamon sticks
1 star anise
2-3 inches fresh ginger, sliced 
1 tsp vanilla or vanilla extract (I used @animamundiherbals vanilla powder )
✨Combine all ingredients in a pot and bring to a boil. Then reduce to low for at least 20 minutes. Strain and store in the refrigerator for up to two weeks. OPTIONAL for a deeper flavor: lightly smash cardamom and black pepper. Then toast cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, fennel and peppercorn before simmering.

🌴6 Tips to feel your best while on vacation!💩 from a holistic nutrition consultant! 

With the holidays and winter coming up, everyone tends to travel a bit more, so I wanted to share these tips to keep you feeling your best! 

If you’re like me, you can get travelers constipation, so I’ve put together my best tips to keep you regular and feeling energized while you travel. I utilized all of these on my recent trip to @iberostar Cancun and felt AMAZING and regular ! 

🎾Move your body: staying on a routine of walking, working out, playing tennis, etc. is going to help you feel your best and keep you regular. 💩

🥝Eat high quality food: I’m all about balance, but I think it is still important to focus on eating enough protein, fat, and fiber at your meals for energy and staying regular…even on vacation. 💩 @iberostar had all sustainable seafood, so we ate a LOT of good seafood! 

💦Stay hydrated: drink lots of water and get some electrolytes in! We were lucky enough to get fresh coconuts post tennis! We needed it because we were SWEATING! 

💆🏻‍♀️Schedule relaxation: If you’re like me, even on vacation you may be a little to go, go, go. I recommend scheduling a massage or some type of self care. Hot tip: a lot of spas have hydrotherapy that you can access for ~$30! Michael and I did the hydrotherapy (free with a treatment) pre massage at @iberostar and it was so relaxing! 

☀️Take walks after meals: this helps with blood sugar balance and energy! It helps to have a gorgeous beach to walk on! 

💊Supplements: bring your typical supplements and throw in some extra magnesium, digestive enzymes, and charcoal just in case.

✨10+ years of “free” veggie and bone broth has saved me a LOT of money and waste. I learned this technique back in my natural chef program and it’s been my favorite low waste recipe of all time. 

All you do is save ALL of your scraps. 🫚🧄🧅
That includes ends of onions, onion skin, veggies that are about to go bad, garlic peels, ginger skin, the ends of greens, and everything in between. You’ll be amazed at how much waste you accrue! 

I mostly use chicken bones for the broth as well because roasting a whole chicken is cheaper and then you can use the leftover bones! 🐓

✨✨Fill your pot with veggie and bone scraps. Fill with filtered water until covered and add in salt, pepper, and bag leaves. Cover and bring to a simmer for a few hours. Strain and enjoy! 

I use this as a base for all of my soups and even drink it alone for the health benefits!

🍯GINGER HONEY SYRUP🫚 is my most made syrup (we are talking weekly) because it has a multitude of applications! 

☕️The number one way I use this syrup is for a quick ginger tea. You simply add the syrup to hot water and enjoy!

🫚Ginger is known for its ability to aid in tummy troubles, but it is also great for your immune system and can help reduce cramps from PMS! 

🍯Make sure to use a high quality local honey and add it in after the water has cooled to keep the beneficial compounds! 

Recipe:

1/4 cup honey
1/4 cup (or more) chopped ginger
✨clean ginger well. I like to soak mine in water, baking soda, and vinegar. Then chop ginger and put in a pot with your water. Bring to a boil and then allow to simmer for around 20 minutes. Let this mixture cool and then blend it with your raw honey. Strain and store in the fridge for ~2 weeks. 

Make sure to save your ginger honey pulp! I love eating it with a spoon for even more benefits or adding it to stir fries!

☕️Herbal High C Hot Toddy Cocktail!🥃 
You can easily make this drink without alcohol, as seen here! 

If you grew up in the South, we sometimes call this drink “southern cough syrup” and is truly so soothing for a dry or sore throat! 

This recipe is from the @herbalacademy Botanical Mixed Drinks Recipe Book and it is just one of the 82 recipes in the book! Also, you can get 15% off all courses and goods with my code rendezvous15 ! 

*GIVEAWAY CLOSED* Lucky for you, we are teaming up to give 3 of these recipe books away to y’all, so make sure you’re following @holisticrendezvous and @herbalacademy, then tag your friends in the comments for a chance to win! Each comment with a tag counts as an entry.

High-C Toddy

Ingredients:
2 fl oz black tea (or whiskey for a cocktail version)
1/2 fl oz rose (Rosa spp.) hip syrup
1/2 fl oz sumac (Rhus spp.) syrup
1/2 fl oz ginger (Zingiber officinale) syrup
1/2 fl oz lemon juice 
Hot water

🍠GF + FOLDABLE SWEET POTATO WRAPS🍠 that are antioxidant rich, anti- inflammatory, and only three ingredients! 

Purple sweet potatoes are a nutrition powerhouse, specifically rich in anthocyanins, which is an antioxidant that gives them a rich purple hue. This is also found in blueberries, but is almost 3 times higher in okinawans! 

Thanks to @beeyawellness for the parchment paper tip because I have only ever made a thick version of these! 

Recipe:
1.5 cups sweet potato (I used purple okinawans, if you use another variety, you may need less sweet potato and more flour as other varieties are more watery) 
1/2 cup cassava flour
1 tsp salt
Optional: other seasonings for an extra flare. I love garlic powder in them! 
✨Steam sweet potatoes. I used my instant pot for this. Steaming works better than baking because they retain more moisture. Remove the skin from your sweet potatoes, then throw all ingredients into a food processor until smooth. Separate dough into ~2 inch balls and then roll out as thin as you can. If you can pull both pieces of parchment off you can do that, but if it starts to tear, use the method shown in the video! Cook on medium heat with a little oil of choice (I prefer ghee) and flip when you see some light browning.

🧈Brown Butter, Miso, + Tahini 🍫Chocolate Chip Cookie🍪 aka the trendsetter cookie because she’s a trendy and buzzwordy little biotch. 

I’m a huge fan of brown butter, miso, and tahini, so I figured you can’t go wrong combining them all. And while I’m not a huge fan of chocolate chips, adding sliced chocolate diffuses the flavor a little more and made these perfect! 

And I know maybe that’s a weird stance so you can always add more or chunkier chocolate if that’s your thing. 

Also, I learned from @kalejunkie to add your egg after you cool the dough in the fridge for a little bit, so take the extra step! 

Recipe:
1/2 cup tahini (@soomfoods is the GOAT)
1 stick butter, browned (@vitalfarms )
1/4 cup miso paste
3/4 cup coconut sugar (I used  @madhavafoods )
1 cup all purpose GF flour ( I used @bobsredmill)
1 tsp baking soda 
1 tsp baking powder
1 tsp vanilla extract 
1 egg ( I used @vitalfarms pasture raised organic) 
Flaky salt (I love @maldonsalt )
Chocolate chips or chopped chocolate bar (choose your own adventure amount) 

✨First, brown your butter by cooking it on medium- high for around 5 minutes/ until it turns caramel. Then add in your vanilla, coconut sugar, miso and tahini. Then mix in your baking powder, baking soda, and flour. Refrigerate for 30 minutes then add in your egg. Once that is combined (it’s going to feel a little tougher at first), add in your chocolate. Preheat oven to 350 and scoop your cookies onto your baking tray. Depending on the size of your cookie, you may need more or less time for baking. I baked for 10-12 minutes. * I also used a scooper and did not need to flatten the cookies, they spread slightly in the oven. Make sure to top with flaky sea salt and enjoy! 

#glutenfreefood #glutenfreecookies #glutenfreecookie #glutenfreecommunity #glutenfreecooking #misocookies #tahinicookies

🍵Golden Milk Matcha🫚 + my thoughts on resolutions during what I like to call cocoon season. 

Every new year we get bombarded with nonstop diet and exercise programs, goal lists, resolutions, transformations, and so on. 

While I love people focusing on their health and bettering themselves, I find this obsession with changing everything January 1 to be more detrimental than helpful (for most!).

Slow change is sustainable change and it’s much easier to implement change when the weather is warmer and the days are longer. 

So be easy on yourself and if you are more in your cocoon era than balls to the walls era, I see you and I’m with you!
